channel.title: Private Servers For Experience?
channel.description:
Well, some of ya may know, that I started Java about 3 weeks ago, and I have progressed fairly well.
Now, I want to gain more experience, without buying another book to read at the same time, and I was wondering if creating a private servers, is a good idea to get experience.
Any other suggestions are highly welcome/appreciated :)
Tanks ya xD

item.title: Private Servers For Experience?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

Krichevskoy wishes he owned me.

Please? I’ll feed him and play with him and take him for walks…

Sleep:

I do not reconmend P-Servers, unless you get a complex source like P16 and go through it and READ everything and take time to figure out what every void does… If you don’t then to hell with them. I just use them in free time and when I’m bored… I’m working on a webJava [:… Going to be like FireFox [:

@OP:
This really should give you your answer - they’re called methods. “void” is just one return type.

Read full topic

item.title: Private Servers For Experience?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:16, topic:53418”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=75323.msg843681#msg843681 date=1170204322]
look what private server fags we have here who think they can code, javac, xero, we dont want more of them.

dont go straight into runescape!!!
[/quote]

It used to be possible to learn via RuneScape, and it was great (that’s essentially what I did).
Unfortunately the community is in a bit of a slump from the education standpoint.
Private servers as they exist on moparisthebest.com are possibly the largest collection of TERRIBLE programming that I’ve ever seen. Honestly, I’m surprised that the server isn’t taking damage from the CSFE.

I’d really really like you to do xeroz all over at Java, i would pay to see that…He fucks you all over and he hasnt had anything to do with them in ages…Infact he doesnt go on any sites like this…

Javac probably has more knowledge in his little finger than you fucktards have in your whole body…

Taharok is very smart, he has a good knwoledge and has worked for what he has recieved so dont go slagging people off you dick

Bring. It. On.[/quote]Lol Krichevskoy owns you all xD

Read full topic

item.title: Private Servers For Experience?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:45, topic:53418”][quote author=ilyaostr9 link=topic=75323.msg853305#msg853305 date=1170402172]

public class MrChris extends Person implements Brain { public boolean wantsToLearnFromPrivateServers = true; public static void main(String[] args) { while(wantsToLearnFromPrivateServers) { Ilya.bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise(MrChris); System.out.println("l2javafromnotnubsrc"); } } }

anybody like my ultra-efficient program?
[/quote]
bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise - I didn’t see that method in there. And if it’s going to be you doing that, maybe you should make that method take your name as a parameter, and his name.

public void bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise(String name, String victim) {
}[/quote]
It’s part of class Person.

class Person extends Species ... ... public void bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise(Person victim) { victim.setIsBeingBashedInTheSkullAndDecidingOtherwise(true); } .... .... }

Everybody extends Person, therefore, I inherit the above mentioned method.

We’re talking about class Person, not class World (Which “Person” extends)

P.S. Try Person.polluteTheWorld(“increase”, “Greenhouse Gases”)
polluteTheWorld(String action, String withWhat) is inherited from class , which class Species extends which class HomoSapiens (now renamed to Person) extends.

Here’s a heirerachy

MrChris extends GFX Designer extends Career extends Person extends Species extends Life extends Biology extends World extends Space extends Infinity extends Time extends (new ClassCastException)

so MrChris has all the methods from Time and all it’s subclasses

Read full topic

item.title: Private Servers For Experience?

[/quote]
anybody like my ultra-efficient program?[/quote]
bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise - I didn’t see that method in there. And if it’s going to be you doing that, maybe you should make that method take your name as a parameter, and his name.

public void bashSkullUntilDecidesOtherwise(String name, String victim) {
}

Read full topic

However, I don’t recommend RS shit, maybe try something like an IRC client/server? using swing tabs for multiple channels or something? Maybe an MSN bot?

item.title: Private Servers For Experience?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:11, topic:53418”]To tell the truth, most private server sources that I have seen follow the worst of worst coding practices, an example of such is comparing 2 objects for equality using == instead of .equals()

However if you were to create your own private server from scratch or something, then that would be a great learning experience.[/quote]
I want to make a source from scratch… it doesn’t take a genius to compare two Strings using the equals() method, or one of the other various string comparison methods.
The thing that’s holding me back is that I don’t know where to start with the content of the parseIncomingPackets().
I see that they call methods from the stream class and so on, but I don’t know why.
Until I get my head around why each particular method is used, I can’t do it myself. =
So if you want to point me in a direction regarding that, then go for it.

Sorry for posting something half irrelevant, but seeing as Chris has already found out what he wanted to know, and seeing as that question of mine doesn’t need a topic of its own I figured I’d just ask here and now.

Read full topic
